Gingham is a medium-weight balanced plain-woven fabric made from dyed cotton or cotton-blend yarn. It is made of carded, medium or fine yarns, where the colouring is on the warp yarns and always along the grain (weft). When the weft yarns are dyed in the same piece, the fabric is called a "self-gingham"; otherwise, it is called a "cross-gingham". It is made of carded, medium or fine yarns, where the colouring is on the warp yarns and always along the grain (weft).
